intro: Corokia × cheesemanii, commonly known as the Cheeseman's flax. It is a hybrid shrub native to New Zealand, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant belongs to the genus Corokia, which is part of the family Garryaceae. It thrives in coastal and dry inland areas, often forming thickets. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
